sub_title: MSc. student at VU, Geology and Geochemistry
summary:
After spending 2 years working in Suriname in two different sectors (Gold sector and Agricultural sector) I came to the realization that I had to expand my educational horizons. This was needed in order to be eligible for opportunities that would normally not be easily granted to an entrée-level with a B.Sc. title.
I am currently working on finishing my M.Sc. at the Vrye Universiteit van Amsterdam, furthermore I am looking for an opportunity to prove myself. My master course is about Geology and Geochemistry, which is a very broad area in itself, educating students about expertise such as forensics and ranging until basic geologic processes in the Earth’s mantle.
I enjoy meeting new people, enjoy cooking, hear exiting new stories about adventures from others (also share my own). 
Professionally I am very  goal orientated, reliable, punctual, ready to learn, and if the job demands, make long distance travels. As I enjoy seeing new places quite a lot. 
My skill-sets include: core-logging, geological mapping, 2-D seismic data interpretation, well correlation, using different gamma ray logs as tools, arc-GIS maps generation. Hope to add alot more in the near future. 
Also, the basics from Microsoft office such as: words, excel, PowerPoint.
